list_definition.definition: a strong alcoholic drink made in Mexico

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: I think I’ll have another tequila.

list_ex_of_english: The course focuses on the history and importance of tequila, federal governmental regulations surrounding tequila production, quality control, and the commercialization of tequila worldwide.
The title line of the chorus translates to, after several tequilas, the clouds go away but the sun doesn't come back.
Some of the flavors are uncommon, such as rose petal, pulque, mole, spearmint, lettuce, shrimp and tequila.
Cuervo was the first distiller to bottle tequila, at a time when other distillers were still using barrels.
Herradura brand tequilas are still made with agave hearts roasted in clay ovens and fermented with wild yeast.
Because only so many distilleries are used, multiple brands of tequila come from the same location.
Once the plant matures, it is harvested like agave plants when mezcal or tequila are to be made.
Like tequila, mezcal is made with the cooked hearts of a species of the maguey or agave plant but the flavor is very different.
